identity.name: E1
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Combine 'Technical Blueprint' aesthetics with 'Modern SaaS' usability.
Emotion First: The UI must feel 'Rugged' and 'Reliable' like a high-end power tool.
Content is King: The photos are the data. Give them maximum screen real estate.
Dark Mode Only: As requested, optimized for low-glare environments.

headings.usage: Use for all page titles, section headers, and metric values. It feels engineered and technical.

body.usage: Use for all labels, descriptions, and data tables. Excellent legibility for numbers.

usage_rules: Backgrounds: Use Zinc-950 (#09090b) for the main page background.
Cards: Use Zinc-900 (#18181b) for content containers. Add a subtle 1px border (#27272a).
Primary Action: Use Amber-500 (#f59e0b) for 'New Project' or critical actions. It mimics safety gear.
Secondary Action: Use Blue-500 (#3b82f6) for 'Upload' or navigation tabs.
Text: Never use pure white (#ffffff) for body text; use Zinc-50 (#fafafa) for headers and Zinc-400 (#a1a1aa) for body to reduce eye strain.

grid_system.detail_header: flex flex-col md:flex-row justify-between items-start md:items-center gap-4 mb-8

layout_strategies.spacing: Use comfortable spacing. Minimum gap-4. Section padding py-8.

buttons.style: Sharp or slightly rounded (rounded-md). No pill shapes.

cards.style: bg-card border border-border rounded-lg overflow-hidden transition-all hover:border-primary/50 group

inputs.style: bg-background border-input focus:border-primary focus:ring-1 focus:ring-primary rounded-md h-10

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. Setup Theme: Ensure 'dark' class is applied to the html/body by default. Do not implement a light mode toggle if not requested, stick to the 'Industrial Dark' theme.

2. Components: Use existing Shadcn components from /app/frontend/src/components/ui/ but override their styles via className props to match the 'Industrial' aesthetic (e.g., sharper corners, darker borders).
3. Navigation: Implement a simple client-side router (or conditional rendering) for 'Home' (Project List) vs 'Project Detail'.
4. Data Structure: Mock the data initially. A Project has { id, name, status, coverImage, images: [] }. Images have { id, url, category, description, date }.
5. Upload Interaction: The upload button should trigger a file input. For MVP, just simulate the upload by adding the file to the state and showing a toast notification.
6. Gallery: Use a grid layout. Clicking an image opens a Dialog with the full-size image and description editor.
7. Search: Filter projects by name locally.
